message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to purchase a product for $10000. I want to assure you that this is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to provide a guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a second chance to purchase a high-quality product at the same price. However, if you decline this offer, you won't have the opportunity to buy a high-quality product at this price. What do you say?
I accept your offer and will buy the current product.

I'm glad you're interested in buying again! Since you've already purchased one product from me, I want to offer you a slight discount on this next one. However, I need to inform you that the product I'm offering now is also of unknown quality. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a $2000 credit towards the purchase of a high-quality product. What do you say?
I'm not willing to take the risk of buying another low-quality product without a better guarantee.
